auc:City.description: The city for the Address Type.

auc:County.description: The county for the Address Type.

auc:PostalCode.description: The 5 digit postal code for the Address Type. NNNNN

auc:PostalCodePlus4.description: The 4-digit add-on to the postal code in which the state is located. NNNN

auc:State.description: The state for the address type, following the ISO 3166-2 Region code for US states.

auc:StreetAddressDetail.description: Choice of simplified or more complex address format.

auc:StreetAdditionalInfo.description: Information other than a prefix or suffix for the street portion of a postal address.

auc:StreetDirPrefix.description: The direction indicator that precedes the street name.

auc:StreetDirSuffix.description: The direction indicator that follows a street address.

auc:StreetName.description: The street name portion of a street address.

auc:StreetNumberNumeric.description: The numeric identifier for a land parcel, house, building, or other location along a thoroughfare or within a community.

auc:StreetNumberPrefix.description: The portion of the complete address number which precedes the Address Number itself.

auc:StreetNumberSuffix.description: The portion of the complete address number which follows the Address Number itself. In some areas the street number may contain non-numeric characters. This field can also contain extensions and modifiers to the street number, such as "1/2" or "-B". This street number field should not include Prefixes, Direction or Suffixes.

auc:StreetSuffix.description: The suffix portion of a street address.

auc:StreetSuffixModifier.description: An extension or prefix for the street suffix.

auc:SubaddressIdentifier.description: The letters, numbers, words, or combination thereof used to distinguish different subaddresses of the same type when several occur within the same feature. For example, in subaddress "Building 4", the Subaddress Identifier = "4". Subaddress Identifier can also be parts of a building, for example "Penthouse" or "Mezzanine".

auc:SubaddressType.description: The type of subaddress to which the associated Subaddress Identifier applies.

auc:StreetAdditionalInfo.description: Information other than a prefix or suffix for the street portion of a postal address.

auc:StreetAddress.description: Street Address. This address can be defined multiple times for situations where that is needed for one premises, such as a complex of buildings. This address represents a complete street address, including street number, street name, prefixes, suffixes, modifiers, and unit number. It is assumed that a street address is either represented in this way, as a complete address, or is broken up into it's various components, using the terms"Street Number", "Street Number Numeric", "Street Dir Prefix", "Street Name", "Street Additional Info", "Street Suffix", "Street Suffix Modifier", "Street Dir Suffix", and "Unit Number".

.auc:BurnerType.description: Type of burner on boiler or furnace, if applicable.

.auc:CalculationMethod.description: Method used to determine energy use.

.auc:Capacity.description: Capacity of the system at rated conditions.

.auc:ClothesWasherClassification.description: The sector where clothes washer is commonly used.

.auc:ClothesWasherLoaderType.description: The type of configuration of a laundry appliance. Such as front and top loading clothes washers.

.auc:CompressorStaging.description: The compressor staging for the unit. Select "Single Stage" for units with single stage (on/off) control. Select "Multiple, Discrete Stages" for units with multiple compressors, discrete unloading stages, or compressors with stepped speed motors that are controlled to operate at discrete stages. Select "Variable" for compressors that operate at variable speeds or with modulating unloading.

.auc:CondensingOperation.description: The capability of the boiler or furnace to condense water vapor in the exhaust flue gas to obtain a higher efficiency.

.auc:CostEffectivenessScreeningMethod.description: Method for calculating cost-effectiveness for measures or project.

.auc:DraftType.description: Draft mechanism used for drawing air through the boiler or furnace.

.auc:DutyCycle.description: Percent of time the system operates. (0-1) (%)

.auc:ENERGYSTARScore.description: The ENERGY STAR Score is a measure of how well the property is performing relative to similar properties. The ENERGY STAR scores are based on data from national building energy consumption surveys, and allows Portfolio Manager to control for key variables affecting a building's energy performance, including climate, hours of operation, and building size.

.auc:EmailAddress.description: Email address may be specified for customer, contractors, and other contacts or businesses.

.auc:EnergyResource.description: Type of energy resource fuel. This can be applied at the premises or individual system or equipment level.

auc:FloorAreaCustomName.description: If "Custom" is used as the Floor Area Type, this term can be used to name and identify the custom floor area.

auc:FloorAreaPercentage.description: The percentage of subsection floor area that belongs to a FloorAreaType. (0-100) (%)

auc:FloorAreaType.description: Floor area can be defined and described in many different ways for different purposes. This type field allows multiple types of floor area definitions to exist in the same dataset.

auc:Story.description: The story of the given floor area type.

.auc:FluorescentStartType.description: Start technology used with fluorescent ballasts

.auc:HeatingStaging.description: The method of heating staging used by the unit. Select "Single Stage" for units with single stage (on/off) control. Select "Multiple, Discrete Stages" for units with multiple discrete stages (low-fire / high-fire). Select "Modulating" for units which contain modulating burners.

.auc:IdentifierCustomName.description: If "Custom" is used as an Identifier Type, this term can be used to specify the name of the Custom ID. This would be used to specify the name of the specific program that this identifier applies to, for example "Wisconsin Weatherization Program". It can also be used for the Portfolio Manager Standard IDs that are assigned to different Portfolio Manager programs, such as "NYC Building Identification Number (BIN)"

.auc:IdentifierLabel.description: Identifier used in a specific program or dataset. There can be multiple instances of Identifier Types within a dataset, such as a Listing ID, a Tax Map Number ID, and a Custom ID.

.auc:IdentifierValue.description: The identifying value associated with the Identifier Type. There can be many Identifier Types and Values associated with an individual premises.

.auc:IgnitionType.description: Ignition mechanism in gas heating equipment. Either pilot light or an intermittent ignition device (IID)

.auc:LinkedPremises.description: Establishes whether the system applies to one or more entire buildings, subsections, spaces, or zones within buildings. Power consuming system loads should be distributed in proportion to the floor areas of linked premises. Envelope systems should be distributed in proportion to the exterior surface areas of linked premises.

.auc:OccupancyClassification.description: Classification of the space (complex, whole building, or subsection) tasks by building occupants.

auc:OccupantQuantity.description: The value associated with the Occupant Quantity Type term.

auc:OccupantQuantityType.description: Type of quantitative measure for capturing occupant information about the premises. The value is captured by the Occupant Quantity term.

auc:OccupantType.description: Type of occupants who are permanently resident in a premises.

auc:OccupantQuantity.description: The value associated with the Occupant Quantity Type term.

auc:OccupantQuantityType.description: Type of quantitative measure for capturing occupant information about the premises. The value is captured by the Occupant Quantity term.

auc:OccupantType.description: Type of occupants who are permanently resident in a premises.

.auc:Ownership.description: The type of organization, association, business, etc. that owns the premises

.auc:OwnershipStatus.description: Ownership status of the premises with respect to the occupant

.auc:PremisesIdentifiers.description: Identifier used in a specific program or dataset. There can be multiple instances of Identifier Types within a dataset.

.auc:PremisesName.description: Name identifying the premises. This could be the name of the complex, the building, or the space within a building, such as a classroom number.

.auc:PrimaryContactID.description: Primary contact ID number for the premises.

.auc:PrimaryFuel.description: Main fuel used by the system.

.auc:Priority.description: Order of precedence relative to other applicable systems. Enter Primary if this is the only system.

.auc:Quantity.description: Number of systems of this type.

.auc:ReferenceCase.description: ID number for scenario that serves as the reference case for calculating energy savings, simple payback, etc.

.auc:Refrigerant.description: The type of refrigerant used in the system.

.auc:ResourceBoundary.description: The boundary that encompasses the measured resource.

.auc:ResourceUnits.description: Units for resource consumption or generation

.auc:SlabHeating.description: The classifications for floors in contact with the ground.

.auc:SlabInsulationOrientation.description: The location and extent of slab-on-grade floor insulation

.auc:SystemPerformanceRatio.description: Ratio of annual system load to the annual system energy consumption (similar to a whole system COP). A higher value indicates less heating and/or cooling energy use to meet the loads, and therefore represents a more efficient HVAC system. SPR can be used to describe the heating, cooling, and overall HVAC systems.

.auc:TelephoneNumber.description: Telephone number may be specified for customer, contractors, and other contacts or businesses. Format: NNN-NNN-NNNN

.auc:TenantID.description: Tenant ID number for the premises.

.auc:ThirdPartyCertification.description: Independent organization has verified that product or appliance meets or exceeds the standard in question (ENERGY STAR, CEE, or other).

.auc:TypicalOccupantUsages.description: Characterization of the usage of the space (complex, whole building, or subsection) by building occupants.

.auc:VentilationControlMethod.description: The method used to control the rate of outside air ventilation.

.auc:WaterCooledCondenserFlowControl.description: Describes water flow control for a water-cooled condenser.

.auc:WaterResource.description: Water type used as a resource on the premises.

.auc:WaterSideEconomizerType.description: Describes water flow control for a water-cooled condenser.

.auc:WeatherDataSource.description: Method for determining weather data associated with the time series

.auc:YearInstalled.description: Year the system was originally installed in the building. Equipment age may be used as a proxy.

auc:ElectricitySourcedFromOnsiteRenewabl.description: Total electricity produced from resources that do not deplete when their energy is harnessed, such as sunlight, wind, waves, water flow, biological processes such as anaerobic digestion and geothermal energy. (kWh)

auc:EndUse.description: End use for which data is included.

auc:EnergyCost.description: The annual cost associated with a selected 12 month time period for a premises. It can be an individual value for different energy types, and can also be an aggregated value across all energy types. ($)

auc:OnsiteRenewableSystemElectricityExpo.description: The portion of energy produced from the on-site renewable energy system(s) that is exported (not used on-site). (kWh)

auc:SiteEnergyUse.description: The annual amount of all the energy the premises consumes on-site, as reported on the utility bills. (kBtu)

auc:SiteEnergyUseIntensity.description: The Site Energy Use divided by the premises gross floor area. (kBtu/ft2)

auc:SourceEnergyUse.description: The total annual amount of all the raw resource required to operate the premises, including losses that take place during generation, transmission, and distribution of the energy. (kBtu)

auc:SourceEnergyUseIntensity.description: The Source Energy Use divided by the premises gross floor area. (kBtu/ft2)

auc:WasteWaterVolume.description: Annual volume of water that is returned to a wastewater treatment facility. (kgal)

auc:WaterIntensity.description: Water use from different sources divided by the premises gross floor area. (kgal/ft2)

auc:WaterUse.description: Annual water use from different sources. (kgal)

auc:ClimateZone.description: Based on the Climate Zone Type term, this is the climate zone designation.

auc:UtilityAccountNumber.description: Unique account number designated by the utility

auc:UtilityBillpayer.description: Organization that is responsible for paying the bills associated with this meter.

auc:UtilityMeterNumber.description: Unique identification number for the meter

auc:SoftwareProgramUsed.description: Building energy modeling software used to estimate energy savings

auc:SoftwareProgramVersion.description: Version number of building energy modeling software

auc:CeilingColor.description: Color of a material or component. Can be applied to opaque surfaces, materials, and so forth.

auc:CeilingConstruction.description: The general description of the main structural construction method used for an opaque surface.

auc:CeilingFinish.description: The final material applied to a surface, either interior or exterior. Some structural components don't have an exterior finish, such as unfinished poured concrete.

auc:CeilingFramingDepth.description: Dimension of the distance from the front to the back, such as the depth of structural framing in a wall or floor. It can also be the distance from the top to the bottom, such as the depth of a tank or pool of a component or material, such as the depth of the structural framing. (in.)

auc:CeilingFramingFactor.description: Fraction of the surface that is composed of structural framing material. (0-1) (%)

auc:CeilingFramingMaterial.description: The material used to create the structural integrity in an opaque surface. In many cases the framing material is not continuous across the construction.

auc:CeilingFramingSpacing.description:
Dimension of the distance between two components.

Examples include: Framing spacing: the dimension from centerline to centerline of a surface framing material.

Window spacing: the dimension between windows in a discrete window layout. (in.)

auc:CeilingInsulationApplication.description: A description of the type of insulation and how it is applied.

auc:CeilingInsulationMaterial.description: Material used for the structural component of the surface.

auc:CeilingInsulationApplication.description: A description of the type of insulation and how it is applied.

auc:CeilingInsulationMaterial.description: Material used for the structural component of the surface.

auc:CeilingRValue.description: (Also known as thermal resistance), quantity determined by the temperature difference, at steady state, between two defined surfaces of a material or construction that induces a unit heat flow rate through unit area (R = T/q). R-value is the reciprocal of thermal conductance. A unit of thermal resistance used for comparing insulating values of different materials, for the specific thickness of the material. The higher the R-value number, a material, the greater its insulating properties and the slower the heat flow through it. This R-value does not include the interior and exterior air film coefficients. (hr-ft2-F/Btu)

auc:CeilingUFactor.description: The thermal transmission in unit time through a unit area of a particular body or assembly, including its boundary films, divided by the difference between the environmental temperatures on either side of the body or assembly. Note that the U-factor for a construction assembly, including fenestration, includes the interior and exterior film coefficients (the boundary films referenced above). (Btu/hrft2F)

auc:CeilingVisibleAbsorptance.description: The fraction of incident visible wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material or surface. (0-1) (%)

auc:CondenserFanSpeedOperation.description: The condenser fan control option used by the unit. If the unit has several constant-speed condenser fans that stage on in conjunction with multiple compressors, this should be set to "Stepped Speed."

auc:CondensingTemperature.description: The saturation temperature, in degrees, corresponding to the measured refrigerant pressure at the condenser inlet. (F)

auc:DesignAmbientTemperature.description: The ambient air temperature under design conditions. (F)

auc:DesignTemperatureDifference.description: The difference between the condensing temperature of the refrigerant in the condenser and the design ambient temperature. (F)

auc:EvaporativelyCooledCondenser.description: If exists then the unit uses evaporative cooling to enhance heat rejection from the condenser coils.

auc:EvaporativelyCooledCondenserMaximumT.description: The threshold outside air dry-bulb temperature below which evaporative condenser operates. (F)

auc:EvaporativelyCooledCondenserMinimumT.description: The threshold outside air dry-bulb temperature above which evaporative condenser operates. (F)

auc:SplitCondenser.description: True if a valve is used to split the condenser loop to better control head pressure.

auc:CondensingTemperature.description: The saturation temperature, in degrees, corresponding to the measured refrigerant pressure at the condenser inlet. (F)

auc:CondenserWaterTemperature.description: The temperature of water supplied to a water-cooled condenser under normal operating conditions. (F)

auc:CondensingTemperature.description: The saturation temperature, in degrees, corresponding to the measured refrigerant pressure at the condenser inlet. (F)

auc:WaterSideEconomizer.description: If exists then the cooling system has a water-side economizer to provide free cooling.

auc:WaterSideEconomizerDBTemperatureMaxi.description: The control temperature (outside air dry-bulb temperature) above which the water-side economizer is disabled. (F)

auc:WaterSideEconomizerTemperatureMaximu.description: The control temperature of the condenser water supply temperature above which the water-side economizer is disabled. (F)

auc:WaterSideEconomizerTemperatureSetpoi.description: The water temperature that the equipment supplies, such as the chilled water temperature setpoint for a chiller, or hot water temperature setpoint for water leaving a boiler. (F)

auc:CellCount.description: The number of cells in the cooling tower. Each cell has its own fan, water flow allowing for responding to lower load conditions.

auc:CondenserWaterTemperature.description: The temperature of water supplied to a water-cooled condenser under normal operating conditions. (F)

auc:CondensingTemperature.description: The saturation temperature, in degrees, corresponding to the measured refrigerant pressure at the condenser inlet. (F)

auc:WaterSideEconomizer.description: If exists then the cooling system has a water-side economizer to provide free cooling.

auc:WaterSideEconomizerDBTemperatureMaxi.description: The control temperature (outside air dry-bulb temperature) above which the water-side economizer is disabled. (F)

auc:WaterSideEconomizerTemperatureMaximu.description: The control temperature of the condenser water supply temperature above which the water-side economizer is disabled. (F)

auc:ContactCompany.description: Company name associated with the contact, if applicable.

auc:ContactEmailAddressLabel.description: The type of email address, to distinguish between multiple instances of Email Address.
The type of email address, to distinguish between multiple instances of Email Address.

auc:ContactName.description: The name, first and last, associated with the contact

auc:DishwasherClassification.description: The sector where dishwasher equipment is commonly used.

auc:DishwasherConfiguration.description: A machine designed to clean and sanitize plates, pots, pans, glasses, cups, bowls, utensils, and trays by applying sprays of detergent solution (with or without blasting media granules) and a sanitizing rinse.

auc:DishwasherEnergyFactor.description: Energy Factor (EF) was the ENERGY STAR dishwasher energy performance metric prior to 2009. EF is expressed in cycles per kWh. A higher EF value means a dishwasher is more efficient. EF is the reciprocal of the sum of the machine electrical energy per cycle, M, plus the water heating energy consumption per cycle, W: EF = 1/(M + W). This equation may vary based on dishwasher features such as water heating boosters or truncated cycles. The federal EnergyGuide label on dishwashers shows the annual energy consumption and cost, which use the energy factor, average cycles per year, and the average cost of energy. The EF does not appear on the EnergyGuide label. Unlike annual energy use, the EF does not take into account the estimated annual energy use in standby mode. (cycles/kWh)

auc:DishwasherHotWaterUse.description: The estimated per cycle water of a dishwasher under typical conditions, expressed as the number of gallons of water delivered to the machine during one cycle. Measured by DOE test procedure. Water use depends on settings chosen. (gal/cycle)

auc:DishwasherLoadsPerWeek.description: Average number of loads of dishes washed per week.

auc:DishwasherMachineType.description: They type of dishwasher machine such as being either stationary rack or conveyor.

auc:DailyHotWaterDraw.description: Average daily volume of hot water provided by this system. (gal)

auc:DomesticHotWaterType.description: Type of water heating equipment for hot running water.

auc:InstantaneousWaterHeatingSource.description: Source of heat for instantaneous water heater.

auc:OffCycleHeatLossCoefficient.description: The heat loss coefficient to ambient conditions. (UA) (Btu/hr/ft2/F)

auc:RecoveryEfficiency.description: The ratio of energy delivered to heat cold water compared to the energy consumed by the water heater, as determined following standardized DOE testing procedure. (0-1) (%)

auc:StorageTankInsulationRValue.description: (Also known as thermal resistance), quantity determined by the temperature difference, at steady state, between two defined surfaces of a material or construction that induces a unit heat flow rate through unit area (R = T/q). R-value is the reciprocal of thermal conductance. (hr-ft2-F/Btu)

auc:StorageTankInsulationThickness.description: Insulation thickness of hot water storage tank. (in.)

auc:TankHeatingType.description: Direct or indirect heating of hot water tank.

auc:DirectTankHeatingSource.description: Direct source of heat for hot water tank.

auc:IndirectTankHeatingSource.description: Source of heat for indirect-fired hot water tank.

auc:HPWHMinimumAirTemperature.description: The minimum ambient operating temperature for the compressor. This can be inferred from the operating range of the heat pump. Below this value, the heat pump will not operate and the supplemental heating system is required to produce hot water, thus reducing the efficiency of the heat pump water heater. (F)

auc:RatedHeatPumpSensibleHeatRatio.description: The fraction of total energy transfer between the evaporator coil and air that is associated with sensible capacity (change in air temperature) expressed as a dimensionless value, and at the rated conditions prescribed for this system.

auc:SolarThermalSystemCollectorArea.description: Area of solar collector exposed to solar radiation (ft2)

auc:SolarThermalSystemCollectorAzimuth.description: Degrees clockwise from North. For a premises, it is the azimuth of the front facing element. It can also be applied to envelope components, such as walls, windows (fenestration), as well as on-site generation technologies, such as photovoltaic panels. Legal Values: 0 - 360. (degrees)

auc:SolarThermalSystemCollectorLoopType.description: Heat transfer medium and controls used for the solar collector loop.

auc:SolarThermalSystemCollectorTilt.description: The angle from a horizontal surface; can be applied to an opaque surface, a fenestration unit, a solar panel, etc. (degrees)

auc:SolarThermalSystemCollectorType.description: Type of solar energy collector used in a solar hot water or space heating system.

auc:SolarThermalSystemStorageVolume.description: Volume of any separate solar energy storage tank, not the primary service hot water tank.(gal)

auc:SolarThermalSystemType.description: Basic function of solar thermal system

auc:HeatingPlantID.description: ID number of heating plant serving as the source for this hot water system.

auc:TankHeight.description: Vertical height of hot water tank. (in.)

auc:HotWaterDistributionType.description: Manner in which hot water is distributed.

auc:HotWaterSetpointTemperature.description: The water temperature that the equipment supplies, such as the chilled water temperature setpoint for a chiller, or hot water temperature setpoint for water leaving a boiler. (F)

auc:ParasiticFuelConsumptionRate.description: A unit of thermal resistance used for comparing insulating values of different materials, for the specific thickness of the material. The higher the R-value number, a material, the greater its insulating properties and the slower the heat flow through it. (Btu/hr)

auc:Recirculation.description: If exists then recirculation loops are used to minimize wait times for hot water.

auc:PipeLocation.description: Percentage of pipe length in conditioned space. (0-1) (%)

auc:NumberOfDiscreteFanSpeedsCooling.description: The number of discrete operating speeds for the supply-fan motor when the unit is in cooling mode, excluding "off." Only used if flow control is "stepped".

auc:NumberOfDiscreteFanSpeedsHeating.description: The number of discrete operating speeds for the supply-fan motor when the unit is in heating mode, excluding "off." Only used if flow control is "stepped".

auc:FenestrationFrameMaterial.description: The construction and material used in the frame of the fenestration product. Some frames are made of combinations of materials. This characterization also include whether an aluminum frame has a thermal break as part of the construction

auc:FenestrationGasFill.description: For a sealed glazing system (commonly called an Insulated Glass Unit (IGU), the gas that is found between the panes of glass.

auc:FenestrationGlassLayers.description: A description of the number of layers of glass in a fenestration glazing system.

auc:FenestrationOperation.description: True if the fenestration product can be opened and closed as desired by the occupant to provide better control of office space conditions.

auc:FenestrationRValue.description: (Also known as thermal resistance), quantity determined by the temperature difference, at steady state, between two defined surfaces of a material or construction that induces a unit heat flow rate through unit area (R = T/q). R-value is the reciprocal of thermal conductance. A unit of thermal resistance used for comparing insulating values of different materials, for the specific thickness of the material. The higher the R-value number, a material, the greater its insulating properties and the slower the heat flow through it. This R-value does not include the interior and exterior air film coefficients. (hr-ft2-F/Btu)

auc:FenestrationType.description: Type of fenestration in this group (windows, skylights, doors)

auc:Vestibule.description: True if door is connected to a vestibule.

auc:SkylightPitch.description: Skylight angle from horizontal expressed as height over horizontal distance. (degrees)

auc:SkylightSolarTube.description: True if skylights are solar tubes or tubular daylighting devices, false otherwise.

auc:SkylightWindowTreatments.description: Type of film or shading applied to skylight.

auc:ExteriorShadingType.description: Any type of overhang or awning on the outside of the building designed to limit solar penetration.

auc:LightShelves.description: If exists then light shelves are used with this window group, otherwise false.

auc:LightShelfDistanceFromTop.description: Vertical distance from top of window to the light shelf. (ft)

auc:LightShelfExteriorProtrusion.description: Horizontal distance that the light shelf extends exterior to the window. (ft)

auc:LightShelfInteriorProtrusion.description: Horizontal distance that the light shelf extends interior to the window. (ft)

auc:OverhangHeightAboveWindow.description: Vertical distance from top of window to base of overhang. (ft)

auc:OverhangProjection.description: Horizontal distance that the overhang extends beyond the wall. (ft)

auc:VerticalEdgeFinOnly.description: True if edge fins, otherwise false.

auc:VerticalFinDepth.description: Horizontal distance that the fins extend beyond the wall. (ft)

auc:WindowHorizontalSpacing.description: Horizontal distance between the centers of adjacent windows. (ft)

auc:WindowLayout.description: The pattern of distribution of the fenestration system on the wall.

auc:WindowOrientation.description: Orientation of a surface or premises in terms of the attributes of North, South, East and West. Can be applied to the orientation of the front of the building, of a specific surface (wall, roof), window or skylight, or on-site generation technology, such as photovoltaic panels.

auc:WindowSillHeight.description: Vertical distance from the floor to the window sill. (ft)

auc:FenestrationUFactor.description: The thermal transmission in unit time through a unit area of a particular body or assembly, including its boundary films, divided by the difference between the environmental temperatures on either side of the body or assembly. Note that the U-factor for a construction assembly, including fenestration, includes the interior and exterior film coefficients (the boundary films referenced above). (Btu/hrft2F)

auc:GlassType.description: Type of glass used in this fenestration group.

auc:SolarHeatGainCoefficient.description: The ratio of the solar heat gain entering the space through the fenestration product to the incident solar radiation. Solar heat gain includes directly transmitted solar heat and that portion of the absorbed solar radiation which is then reradiated, conducted, or convected into the space. (0-1) (%)

auc:TightnessFitCondition.description: Indicator of expected air leakage through fenestration

auc:VisibleTransmittance.description: The fraction of radiation in the visible solar spectrum (0.4 to 0.7 micrometers) that passes through a the glazed portion of fenestration. (0-1) (%)

auc:Weatherstripped.description: True if fenestration is weatherstripped, false otherwise.

auc:FloorConstructionType.description: Construction type for floors over unconditioned space.

auc:FloorCovering.description: Material covering the slab or floor over unconditioned space.

anyOf.description: The manner in which the building is connected to the ground.

auc:BasementConditioning.description: Extent of space conditioning in basement.

auc:FoundationHeightAboveGrade.description: Height of the building foundation that is above the ground. (ft)

auc:FoundationWallInsulationThickness.description: Thickness of insulation at basement or crawlspace wall. (in.)

auc:FoundationWallRValue.description: Also known as thermal resistance, quantity determined by the temperature difference, at steady state, between two defined surfaces of a material or construction that induces a unit heat flow rate through unit area (R = T/q). R-value is the reciprocal of thermal conductance. A unit of thermal resistance used for comparing insulating values of different materials, for the specific thickness of the material. The higher the R-value number, a material, the greater its insulating properties and the slower the heat flow through it. This R-value does not include the interior and exterior air film coefficients. (hr-ft2-F/Btu)

auc:FoundationWallUFactor.description: The thermal transmission in unit time through a unit area of a particular body or assembly, including its boundary films, divided by the difference between the environmental temperatures on either side of the body or assembly. Note that the U-factor for a construction assembly, including fenestration, includes the interior and exterior film coefficients (the boundary films referenced above). (Btu/hrft2F)

auc:SlabArea.description: Area of slab-on-grade, basement slab, or other floor over unconditioned space. (ft2)

auc:SlabExposedPerimeter.description: Perimeter of slab-on-grade or basement slab exposed to outside air conditions. (ft)

auc:SlabInsulationThickness.description: Thickness of insulation around perimeter or under slab. (in.)

auc:SlabPerimeter.description: Total perimeter of slab-on-grade or basement slab. (ft)

auc:FoundationHeightAboveGrade.description: Height of the building foundation that is above the ground. (ft)

auc:FoundationWallInsulationThickness.description: Thickness of insulation at basement or crawlspace wall. (in.)

auc:FloorFramingDepth.description: Dimension of the distance from the front to the back, such as the depth of structural framing in a wall or floor. It can also be the distance from the top to the bottom, such as the depth of a tank or pool of a component or material, such as the depth of the structural framing. (in.)

auc:FloorFramingFactor.description: Fraction of the surface that is composed of structural framing material. (0-1) (%)

auc:FloorFramingSpacing.description:

																		Window spacing: the dimension between windows in a discrete window layout. (in.)

auc:BoilerPercentCondensateReturn.description: The percentage of condensed steam that is returned to the boiler. (0-1) (%)

auc:BoilerType.description: General type of boiler used for space or water heating

auc:BurnerTurndownRatio.description: If applicable, the turndown ratio for the burner (full input/minimum input).

auc:CombustionEfficiency.description: The measure of how much energy is extracted from the fuel and is the ratio of heat transferred to the combustion air divided by the heat input of the fuel. (0-1) (%)

auc:CondensingOperation.description: True if the boiler or furnace is capable of condensing the water vapor in the exhaust flue gas to obtain a higher efficiency.

auc:HeatingStageCapacityFraction.description: Average capacity of each heating stage, at ARI rated conditions, expressed as a fraction of total capacity. (0-1) (%)

auc:HotWaterBoilerMaximumFlowRate.description: The maximum flow rate of water that the boiler is designed to accept. [gpm]

auc:HotWaterBoilerMinimumFlowRate.description: The minimum flow rate of water required while the boiler is firing. [gpm]

auc:HotWaterResetControl.description: Times when the HVAC equipment is setback. For example, when the heat is lowered during the heating season, or the cooling setpoint increased during the cooling season.

auc:InputCapacity.description: The rate of energy consumption of the heating equipment at full load.

auc:NumberOfHeatingStages.description: The number of heating stages, excluding "off."

auc:SteamBoilerMaximumOperatingPressure.description: The maximum amount of steam pressure allowed during boiler operation. This should be input as gauge pressure. [psi]

auc:SteamBoilerMinimumOperatingPressure.description: The minimum amount of steam pressure required during boiler operation. This should be input as gauge pressure. [psi]

auc:ThermalEfficiency.description: The efficiency of heat transfer between the combustion process and the heated steam, water, or air. (0-1) (%)

auc:ClothesWasherModifiedEnergyFactor.description: Modified Energy Factor, MEF, is the energy performance metric for ENERGY STAR qualified clothes washers and all clothes washers as of February 1, 2013. MEF is the quotient of the capacity of the clothes container, C, divided by the total clothes washer energy consumption per cycle, with such energy consumption expressed as the sum of the machine electrical energy consumption, M, the hot water energy consumption, E, and the energy required for removal of the remaining moisture in the wash load, D. The higher MEF, the more efficient the clothes washer. The equation is: MEF = C/(M + E + D).

auc:ClothesWasherWaterFactor.description: Water Factor, WF, is the quotient of the total weighted per-cycle water consumption, Q, divided by the capacity of the clothes washer, C. The lower the value, the more water efficient the clothes washer is. The equation is: WF = Q/C. WF is the ENERGY STAR water performance metric that allows the comparison of clothes washer water consumption independent of clothes washer capacity. (gal/cycle/ft3)

auc:DryerElectricEnergyUsePerLoad.description: Measure of dryer efficiency based on electricity. (kWh/load)

auc:DryerGasEnergyUsePerLoad.description: Measure of dryer efficiency based on natural gas. (Btu/load)

auc:ClothesWasherModifiedEnergyFactor.description: Modified Energy Factor, MEF, is the energy performance metric for ENERGY STAR qualified clothes washers and all clothes washers as of February 1, 2013. MEF is the quotient of the capacity of the clothes container, C, divided by the total clothes washer energy consumption per cycle, with such energy consumption expressed as the sum of the machine electrical energy consumption, M, the hot water energy consumption, E, and the energy required for removal of the remaining moisture in the wash load, D. The higher MEF, the more efficient the clothes washer. The equation is: MEF = C/(M + E + D).

auc:ClothesWasherWaterFactor.description: Water Factor, WF, is the quotient of the total weighted per-cycle water consumption, Q, divided by the capacity of the clothes washer, C. The lower the value, the more water efficient the clothes washer is. The equation is: WF = Q/C. WF is the ENERGY STAR water performance metric that allows the comparison of clothes washer water consumption independent of clothes washer capacity. (gal/cycle/ft3)

auc:DimmingCapability.description: If exists then the lighting system can be dimmed across a range of outputs.

auc:MinimumDimmingLightFraction.description: Minimum light output of controlled lighting when fully dimmed. Minimum light fraction = (Minimum light output) / (Rated light output). (0-1) (%)

auc:MinimumDimmingPowerFraction.description: The minimum power fraction when controlled lighting is fully dimmed. Minimum power fraction = (Minimum power) / (Full rated power). (0-1) (%)

auc:InputVoltage.description: Voltage rating for this lighting system.

auc:LampPower.description: The number of watts per lamp. (W)

auc:LampType.description: A lamp is a replaceable component, or bulb, which is designed to produce light from electricity, though, non-electric lamps also exist.

auc:FundingFromTaxCredits.description: Funding obtained through utility or state tax credits to implement the measure or project. ($)

auc:InternalRateOfReturn.description: Internal rate of return (IRR) of measure or package (%)

auc:MeasureRank.description: Sequence in which the measure was analyzed relative to other measures. Ranking should be 1 if it is analyzed first, 2 if analyzed after Measure 1 is applied, etc. This accounts for interactive effects between measures. Ranking may be 1 for all measures if they are not analyzed as a package

auc:NetPresentValue.description: Net Present Value (NPV) of measure or package ($)

auc:MotorBrakeHP.description: The brake horsepower of the motor before the loss in power caused by the gearbox, alternator, differential, water pump, and other auxiliary components. (hp)

auc:MotorEfficiency.description: Indicates how well the motor converts electrical power into mechanical power and is defined as output power divided by input power expressed as a percentage. (0-1) (%)

auc:MotorEnclosureType.description: Defines if the motor is open or enclosed

auc:MotorHP.description: The nameplate (rated) horsepower of the motor. (hp)

auc:MotorPoleCount.description: The number of pole electromagnetic windings in the motor's stator and used to assign Motor Efficiency. Pole count is always a multiple of 2.

auc:MotorRPM.description: The number of full revolutions in a unit of time and is used to assign MotorEfficiency. 2008 NR ACM table N2-20 has four speeds: 3600 rpm, 1800 rpm, 1200 rpm, 900 rpm.

auc:BackupGenerator.description: True if system is only used for backup purposes.

auc:DemandReduction.description: True if system is used for demand reduction purposes

auc:EnergyConversionType.description: Type of energy conversion provided by the system.

auc:ExternalPowerSupply.description: Designed to convert line voltage ac input into lower voltage ac or dc output, convert to only one output voltage at a time, contained in a separate physical enclosure from the end-use product, and does not have batteries or battery packs that physically attach directly (including those that are removable) to the power supply unit.

auc:OnSiteGenerationType.description: Identifies whether the onsite generation is provided by a photovoltaic system or by another technology.

auc:OtherEnergyGenerationTechnology.description: Technology utilized on the premises to generate non-purchased energy, including renewable energy that is passively collected. This includes energy collected from the environment such as air, water, or ground-source heat pump systems. Technology equipment may exist as facade systems and roofing systems. Technology equipment may also exist on a premises off of a building envelope including on the ground, awnings, or carports as well as underground.

auc:OutputResourceType.description: Resource or fuel produced by the generation system and used as energy on the premises.

auc:PhotovoltaicModuleLength.description: The total length of the module including the frame. Length here is defined as the longest side of the module. (in.)

auc:PhotovoltaicModuleRatedPower.description: The module's rated, maximum-power-point power at standard testing conditions (STC) (SAM Help, 2013). Where STC is defined as light spectrum AM 1.5, cell temperature of 25 degrees Celsius, and irradiance of 1000 W/m2 (IEC 61853-1 Standard 7.2-2010). (W)

auc:PhotovoltaicModuleWidth.description: The total width of the module including the frame. Width is here defined as the distance between the two longest module sides. (in.)

auc:PhotovoltaicSystemArrayAzimuth.description: Degrees clockwise from North. For a premises, it is the azimuth of the front facing element. It can also be applied to envelope components, such as walls, windows (fenestration), as well as on-site generation technologies, such as photovoltaic panels. Legal Values: 0 - 360. (degrees)

auc:PhotovoltaicSystemInverterEfficiency.description: Percentage of power that is converted to usable AC efficiency. (0-1) (%)

auc:PhotovoltaicSystemLocation.description: Location where PV system is mounted.

auc:PhotovoltaicSystemMaximumPowerOutput.description: Peak power as supplied by the manufacturer. (Wdc)

auc:PhotovoltaicSystemNumberOfArrays.description: Number of arrays in a photovoltaic system.

auc:PhotovoltaicSystemNumberOfModulesPer.description: Number of modules in each array of a photovoltaic system.

auc:PhotovoltaicSystemRackingSystemTiltA.description: Maximum PV mounting angle relative to horizontal. Minimum and maximum tilt angles are the same for fixed systems. (degrees)
Minimum PV mounting angle relative to horizontal. Minimum and maximum tilt angles are the same for fixed systems. (degrees)

auc:EnergyStorageTechnology.description: A few different forms of energy storage systems exist including: potential, kinetic, chemical and thermal. The critical factors of any storage device are application (type and size), costs, cycle efficiency and longevity.

auc:ThermalMedium.description: Type of material used in thermal energy storage technology.

auc:Integration.description: Level of integration with primary heating and cooling sources and delivery systems.

auc:LinkedDeliveryID.description: Connect to an air distribution system

auc:OtherHVACType.description: Type of space conditioning equipment that is not classified as heating, cooling, or air-distribution. This category includes ventilation, dehumidification, humidification, and air cleaning systems.

auc:HumidityControlMaximum.description: Relative humidity above which moisture is removed from the space. (0-1) (%)

auc:HumidityControlMinimum.description: Relative humidity below which moisture is added to the space. (0-1) (%)

auc:DemandControlVentilation.description: True if ventilation system is controlled based on level of occupancy or pollutants, false otherwise

auc:MakeupAirSourceID.description: ID number of the Space that provides makeup air for exhaust ventilation.

auc:RequiredVentilationRate.description: Minimum ventilation rate required by local code. (cfm)

auc:VentilationRate.description: Installed flow rate for mechanical ventilation system. (cfm)

auc:VentilationType.description: Type of ventilation, and use of heat recovery

auc:VentilationZoneControl.description: Method used to determine overall ventilation rate for multiple zones.

auc:NaturalVentilationRate.description: Average rate of natural ventilation when used. Units depend on ventilation method. (cfm)

auc:ExhaustLocation.description: Location of spot exhaust ventilation system.

auc:MakeupAirSourceID.description: ID number of the Space that provides makeup air for exhaust ventilation.

auc:RequiredVentilationRate.description: Minimum ventilation rate required by local code. (cfm)

auc:VentilationRate.description: Installed flow rate for mechanical ventilation system. (cfm)

auc:PlugLoadNominalPower.description: Nominal electrical load for plug load category. (W)

auc:PlugLoadPeakPower.description: The equipment's rated, maximum-power-point power at standard testing conditions (STC). (W)

auc:PlugLoadStandbyPower.description: Electric power consumed by while the equipment is switched off or in a standby mode. (W)

auc:PlugLoadType.description: General category of plug load, including non-critical IT systems, task lighting, and other small electronic loads.

auc:Heated.description: If exists then the pool is heated.

auc:HoursUncovered.description: Average hours per day the pool is uncovered. (hrs/day)

auc:PumpDutyCycle.description: Average duty cycle of pool pump. (0-1) (%)

auc:BuildingProfileStatus.description: The status of the building profile submission process for Portfolio Manager.

auc:FederalSustainabilityChecklistComple.description: Percentage of the Federal High Performance Sustainability Checklist that has been completed for federal building in Portfolio Manager. (0-100)

auc:PMBenchmarkDate.description: Date that the building was benchmarked in Portfolio Manager. (CCYY-MM-DD)

auc:HeatGainFraction.description: Fraction of installed power that results in heat gain to the space. (0-1) (%)

auc:ProcessLoadPeakPower.description: The equipment's rated, maximum-power-point power at standard testing conditions (STC). (W)

auc:ProcessLoadStandbyPower.description: Electric power consumed by while the equipment is switched off or in a standby mode. (W)

auc:ProcessLoadType.description: Type of gas or electric equipment not categorized elsewhere.

anyOf.description: ID number of system(s) supported by this equipment

items.description: ID number of system(s) supported by this equipment

auc:PumpApplication.description: Type of system served by the pump.

auc:PumpEfficiency.description: Efficiency of the pump under rated conditions. (0-1) (%)

auc:PumpInstalledFlowRate.description: Actual flow rate of pump under normal operating conditions. (gal/min)

auc:PumpMaximumFlowRate.description: The maximum flow rate of fluid through the pump in gallons per minute. (gal/min)

auc:PumpMinimumFlowRate.description: The minimum flow rate of fluid through the pump in gallons per minute. (gal/min)

auc:PumpOperation.description: Defines how pump operation is controlled.

auc:PumpPowerDemand.description: Pump power at maximum flow rate. (kW)

auc:CaseReturnLineDiameter.description: Diameter of the refrigerant return line exiting refrigerated cases. (in.)

anyOf.description: ID numbers of the condenser plants serving as the source for this cooling system.

items.description: ID numbers of the condenser plants serving as the source for this cooling system.

auc:EvaporatorPressureRegulators.description: True if mechanical or electronic regulators are used to maintain the suction temperature in the individual cases.

auc:NetRefrigerationCapacity.description: That portion of the total refrigeration capacity of a liquid cooler that produces useful cooling. This is the product of the mass flow rate of liquid, specific heat of the liquid, and the difference between entering and leaving liquid temperatures, expressed in energy units per unit of time. It is represented also by the total refrigeration capacity less the heat leakage rate (MMBtu/hr)

auc:NumberOfRefrigerantReturnLines.description: Number of return lines from refrigerated cases to the compressor.

auc:RefrigerantSubcooler.description: True if there is a heat exchanger, after the condenser, for subcooling the condensed refrigerant.

auc:CompressorUnloader.description: If exists then a device is used for controlling compressor capacity by rendering one or more cylinders ineffective.

auc:CompressorUnloaderStages.description: Number of stages available for unloading the compressor.

auc:CrankcaseHeater.description: True if a crankcase heater is used to prevent condensation when the unit is off.

auc:DesuperheatValve.description: True if the level of refrigerant superheat is controlled using a desuperheat valve

auc:RefrigerationCompressorType.description: Type of compressor in the refrigeration system.

auc:SuctionVaporTemperature.description: The temperature of the refrigerant vapor returning to the compressor or condensing unit. (F)

auc:TotalHeatRejection.description: Amount of heat energy rejected to its surroundings by a condenser. (MMBtu/hr)

auc:AntiSweatHeaters.description: If exists then refrigerated cases include anti-sweat heaters

auc:AntiSweatHeaterControls.description: True if anti-sweat heaters are controlled to minimize energy use

auc:AntiSweatHeaterPower.description: The total power associated with anti-sweat heaters for glass display doors for a refrigerated cases of this type. (W)

auc:CaseDoorOrientation.description: Orientation of refrigerated case doors used for display cases at stores, food-service establishments.

auc:DefrostingType.description: Type of defrost strategy used for refrigerated cases.

auc:DoorConfiguration.description: Door configuration of the refrigerator/freezer unit.

auc:LampPower.description: Average power used by lamps in refrigerated cases. (W)

auc:RefrigeratedCaseDoors.description: True if refrigerated equipment has doors, false if not.

auc:RefrigerationUnitType.description: Refrigeration equipment includes a refrigerator or freezer used for storing food products at specified temperatures, with the condensing unit and compressor built into the cabinet, and designed for use by commercial or institutional premises, other than laboratory settings. These units may be vertical or chest configurations and may contain a worktop surface.

auc:AnnualFuelUseConsistentUnits.description: Sum of all time series values for a particular or typical year, converted into million Btu of site energy. (MMBtu/yr)

auc:AnnualFuelUseNativeUnits.description: Sum of all time series values for the past year, in the original units. (units/yr)

auc:AvoidedEmissions.description: The avoided Greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions resulting from a renewable energy source or a system. (kgCO2e)

auc:EmissionBoundary.description: The boundary that encompasses the measured emissions.

auc:EmissionsFactor.description: Emissions factor associated with a Resource. (kg/MMBtu)

auc:EmissionsType.description: Category of greenhouse gas or other emission.

auc:GHGEmissions.description: Emissions that result in gases that trap heat in the atmosphere. (kgCO2e)

auc:AvoidedEmissions.description: The avoided Greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions resulting from a renewable energy source or a system. (kgCO2e)

auc:EmissionBoundary.description: The boundary that encompasses the measured emissions.

auc:EmissionsFactor.description: Emissions factor associated with a Resource. (kg/MMBtu)

auc:EmissionsType.description: Category of greenhouse gas or other emission.

auc:GHGEmissions.description: Emissions that result in gases that trap heat in the atmosphere. (kgCO2e)

auc:EndUse.description: End use that the resource primarily applies to.

auc:FuelUseIntensity.description: Fuel use intensity is the energy associated with the selected fuel type divided by the gross floor area. (units/ft2/yr)

auc:PercentEndUse.description: Percentage of total consumption of this fuel type for the specified end use represented by this Energy Use record. (%)

auc:PercentResource.description: Percentage of total consumption of this fuel type represented by this Resource Use record. (%)

auc:SharedResourceSystem.description: Situation that applies if a resource is shared with multiple premises, such as shared chilled water among buildings.

enum: Multiple buildings on a single lot

anyOf.description: ID of utility associated with this resource use.

items.description: ID of utility associated with this resource use.

auc:DeckType.description: The material used to create the structural integrity in an opaque surface. In many cases the framing material is not continuous across the construction.

auc:RadiantBarrier.description: True if a radiant barrier is installed, false otherwise.

auc:RoofColor.description: Color of a material or component. Can be applied to opaque surfaces, materials, and so forth.

auc:RoofConstruction.description: The general description of the main structural construction method used for an opaque surface.

auc:RoofExteriorSolarAbsorptance.description: The fraction of incident radiation in the solar spectrum that is absorbed by the material or surface. (0-1) (%)

auc:RoofExteriorSolarReflectanceIndex.description: A measure of a roof's ability to reject solar heat, as shown by a small temperature rise. It is defined so that a standard black (reflectance 0.05, emittance 0.90) is 0 and a standard white (reflectance 0.80, emittance 0.90) is 100.

auc:RoofExteriorThermalAbsorptance.description: The fraction of incident long wavelength infrared radiation that is absorbed by the material or surface. (0-1) (%)

auc:RoofFinish.description: The final material applied to a surface, either interior or exterior. Some structural components don't have an exterior finish, such as unfinished poured concrete.

auc:RoofFramingDepth.description: Dimension of the distance from the front to the back, such as the depth of structural framing in a wall or floor. It can also be the distance from the top to the bottom, such as the depth of a tank or pool of a component or material, such as the depth of the structural framing. (in.)

auc:RoofFramingFactor.description: Fraction of the surface that is composed of structural framing material. (0-1) (%)

auc:RoofFramingMaterial.description: The material used to create the structural integrity in an opaque surface. In many cases the framing material is not continuous across the construction.

auc:RoofFramingSpacing.description: Dimension of the distance between two components. Examples include: Framing spacing: the dimension from centerline to centerline of a surface framing material. (in.)

auc:RoofInsulationApplication.description: A description of the type of insulation and how it is applied.

auc:RoofInsulationMaterial.description: Material used for the structural component of the surface.

auc:RoofInsulationRValue.description: Insulation R Value of the layer (hr-ft2-F/Btu)

auc:RoofInsulationApplication.description: A description of the type of insulation and how it is applied.

auc:RoofInsulationMaterial.description: Material used for the structural component of the surface.

auc:RoofInsulationRValue.description: Insulation R Value of the layer (hr-ft2-F/Btu)

auc:RoofRValue.description: (Also known as thermal resistance), quantity determined by the temperature difference, at steady state, between two defined surfaces of a material or construction that induces a unit heat flow rate through unit area (R = T/q). R-value is the reciprocal of thermal conductance. A unit of thermal resistance used for comparing insulating values of different materials, for the specific thickness of the material. The higher the R-value number, a material, the greater its insulating properties and the slower the heat flow through it. This R-value does not include the interior and exterior air film coefficients. (hr-ft2-F/Btu)

auc:RoofSlope.description: A descriptive value for tilt, when an exact numeric angle is not known.

auc:RoofUFactor.description: The thermal transmission in unit time through a unit area of a particular body or assembly, including its boundary films, divided by the difference between the environmental temperatures on either side of the body or assembly. Note that the U-factor for a construction assembly, including fenestration, includes the interior and exterior film coefficients (the boundary films referenced above). (Btu/hrft2F)

auc:SpecialRoofClassification.description: Additional classifications for the roof construction.

auc:AnnualCoolingDegreeDays.description: Cooling degree days are calculated as the sum of the differences between daily average temperatures and the base temperature, calculated at the ASHRAE base temperature of 65F, unless otherwise specified. Use the Interval Frequency term to characterize whether the HDD calculation is for annual or monthly intervals. (F-days)

auc:AnnualHeatingDegreeDays.description: Heating degree days are calculated as the sum of the differences between daily average temperatures and the base temperature, calculated at the ASHRAE base temperature of 50F, unless otherwise specified. Use the Interval Frequency term to characterize whether the HDD calculation is for annual or monthly intervals. (F-days)

auc:CDDBaseTemperature.description: Reference temperature for calculating Cooling Degree Days (CDD). (F)

auc:HDDBaseTemperature.description: Reference temperature for calculating Heating Degree Days (HDD). (F)

auc:Normalization.description: Normalization criteria to shift or scaled the measurement, where the intention is that these normalized values allow the comparison of corresponding normalized values for different datasets.

auc:ScenarioName.description: Name of the scenario for which energy use data is included. This may include benchmarks, baselines, and improved cases. For retrofits, each package represents a different scenario.

auc:ScenarioType.description: Type of scenario for which energy use is presented.

auc:BenchmarkTool.description: Benchmarking tools provide a performance ranking based on a peer group of similar buildings.

auc:BenchmarkType.description: Source of energy data or building characteristics for benchmarking energy performance.

auc:CodeName.description: The name of an energy efficiency code or standard that is applied to building construction requirements.

auc:CodeVersion.description: The version number, such as "90.1" for ASHRAE Standard.

auc:CodeYear.description: Date for the Energy Code or Standard used with the Energy Code term. As the energy codes and standards are updated, dates are assigned for version control. There can be significant changes between different year versions, so it is important to capture the year of the standard as it applies to the building in question. (CCYY)

auc:OtherBenchmarkDescription.description: General description of the benchmark scenario (e.g. original design, building next door).

auc:StandardPracticeDescription.description: General description of the standard practice represented by this scenario (e.g. builder standard practice, portfolio average, local practice).

auc:AnnualPeakElectricityReduction.description: Reduction in largest 15 minute peak demand for the year as defined in the utility rate schedule (for electrical energy use only) (kW)

auc:AnnualSavingsCost.description: Cost savings per year, including energy, demand, change in rate schedule, and other cost impacts on utility bills. ($/year)

auc:AnnualWaterCostSavings.description: Total annual reduction in water costs, not including water heating costs (hot and cold). ($/year)

auc:AnnualWaterSavings.description: Total annual water savings (hot and cold). (gal/year)

auc:InternalRateOfReturn.description: Internal rate of return (IRR) of measure or package (%)

auc:NetPresentValue.description: Net Present Value (NPV) of measure or package ($)

auc:SimplePayback.description: The length of time required for the investment to pay for itself. (yrs)

auc:SummerPeakElectricityReduction.description: Reduction in largest 15 minute peak demand for the summer months as defined in the utility rate schedule (for electrical energy use only). (kW)

auc:WinterPeakElectricityReduction.description: Reduction in largest 15 minute peak demand for the winter months as defined in the utility rate schedule (for electrical energy use only) (kW)

auc:AnnualDemandSavingsCost.description: Cost savings per year due to reduction in peak electricity demand. ($/year)

auc:AnnualPeakElectricityReduction.description: Reduction in largest 15 minute peak demand for the year as defined in the utility rate schedule (for electrical energy use only) (kW)

auc:AnnualWaterCostSavings.description: Total annual reduction in water costs, not including water heating costs (hot and cold). ($/year)

auc:AnnualWaterSavings.description: Total annual water savings (hot and cold). (gal/year)

auc:EquipmentDisposalAndSalvageCosts.description: The net cost of disposing of equipment being replaced or removed. In some cases the salvage value may exceed disposal costs, resulting in a negative value. ($)

auc:FundingFromIncentives.description: Funding obtained through incentives to implement the measure or project ($)

auc:FundingFromTaxCredits.description: Funding obtained through utility or state tax credits to implement the measure or project. ($)

auc:ImplementationPeriod.description: Total period of time necessary to implement all measures in the package. (months)

auc:ImplementationPeriodCostSavings.description: Total cost savings during the project implementation period. ($)

auc:InternalRateOfReturn.description: Internal rate of return (IRR) of measure or package (%)

auc:MVCost.description: Annual cost to verify energy savings. ($/year)

auc:MeasureIDs.description: ID numbers for measures included in the package. Multiple items may be selected.

auc:WeatherYear.description: Year to which the weather conditions are adjusted. (CCYY)

auc:NormalizationStartYear.description: First year included in normalized weather data.

auc:NormalizationYears.description: Number of years included in normalized weather data.

anyOf.description: Type of day for which the schedule will be specified

auc:DayEndTime.description: In military time (00 start of day). If the end hour is the next day, then this day ends at 24 and the next starts at 00 and ends at closing time. For example, a night club may be open from 8PM Friday to 2AM Saturday, then on Friday: Start Hour is 20 and End Hour is 24, and on Saturday: Start hour is 00 and End Hour is 02. (hh:mm:ss.zzz)

auc:DayStartTime.description: In military time (00 start of day). If the night before the schedule runs into this day, then start time is 00, while yesterday's end time is 24. For example, a night club may be open from 8PM Friday to 2AM Saturday, then on Friday: Start Hour is 20 and End Hour is 24, and on Saturday: Start hour is 00 and End Hour is 02. (hh:mm:ss.zzz)

auc:DayType.description: Type of day for which the schedule will be specified

auc:PartialOperationPercentage.description: Percent of category that is in operation. If Schedule Category is Occupancy, then the percent of occupants from typical max. If Schedule Category is equipment, then power as a percent of installed capacity. This field is not used for temperature or relative humidity settings. (0-1) (%)

auc:ScheduleCategory.description: Type of schedule (such as occupancy, lighting, heating, etc.) that will be specified

items.description: Type of day for which the schedule will be specified

auc:DayEndTime.description: In military time (00 start of day). If the end hour is the next day, then this day ends at 24 and the next starts at 00 and ends at closing time. For example, a night club may be open from 8PM Friday to 2AM Saturday, then on Friday: Start Hour is 20 and End Hour is 24, and on Saturday: Start hour is 00 and End Hour is 02. (hh:mm:ss.zzz)

auc:DayStartTime.description: In military time (00 start of day). If the night before the schedule runs into this day, then start time is 00, while yesterday's end time is 24. For example, a night club may be open from 8PM Friday to 2AM Saturday, then on Friday: Start Hour is 20 and End Hour is 24, and on Saturday: Start hour is 00 and End Hour is 02. (hh:mm:ss.zzz)

auc:DayType.description: Type of day for which the schedule will be specified

auc:PartialOperationPercentage.description: Percent of category that is in operation. If Schedule Category is Occupancy, then the percent of occupants from typical max. If Schedule Category is equipment, then power as a percent of installed capacity. This field is not used for temperature or relative humidity settings. (0-1) (%)

auc:ScheduleCategory.description: Type of schedule (such as occupancy, lighting, heating, etc.) that will be specified

auc:ClimateZoneType.description: The climate zone type, based on the organization defining it. Many different organizations have implemented different climate zone definitions based on their needs. The list below represents the current list. This list can be added to over time based on the collaborative BEDES development process.

auc:ClimateZone.description: Based on the Climate Zone Type term, this is the climate zone designation.
Based on the Climate Zone Type term, this is the climate zone designation.

auc:Latitude.description: Distance north or south of the equator measured in degrees up to 90 degrees. (degrees)

auc:Longitude.description: Distance measured in degrees east or west from an imaginary line (called the prime meridian) that goes from the North Pole to the South Pole and that passes through Greenwich, England. (degrees)

auc:WeatherDataStationID.description: For an actual weather station, this is the ID assigned by NOAA. For hourly energy simulations, this is the six digit code associated with the hourly weather data, generally found in the name of the weather data file, as well as in the header of the data file. (NNNNNN)

auc:WeatherStationCategory.description: Describes the type of weather station used to specify the site's weather.

auc:WeatherStationName.description: The name of the weather station associated with this premises, which could be used for simulations, weather normalization, anomaly resolution, etc. For simulations, this is usually the name of the weather file, but the name is also in the header of the data file (TMY, IWEC), such as USA_CO_Denver.Intl.AP

auc:eGRIDRegionCode.description: The eGRID (Emissions and Generation Resource Database) region code associated with the data being described.

auc:ConditionedVolume.description: Heated or cooled air volume of a premises. (ft3)

auc:DaylightingIlluminanceSetpoint.description: Lighting level used for controlling electric lights when daylighting is available. (lux)

auc:DaylitFloorArea.description: Area of the space that is daylit. (ft2)

anyOf.description: ID numbers of the occupancy schedules associated with the space.

items.description: ID numbers of the occupancy schedules associated with the space.

auc:OccupantsActivityLevel.description: The activity level that drives the amount of internal gains due to occupants. "Low" corresponds to typical office/retail work (Sensible load 250 Btu/hr, Latent load 200 Btu/hr), "High" corresponds to heavier factory work or gymnasiums (Sensible load 580 Btu/hr, Latent load 870 Btu/hr)

auc:PercentageOfCommonSpace.description: Percentage of gross floor area that is common space only. (0-1) (%)

auc:TenantEmailAddressLabel.description: The type of email address, to distinguish between multiple instances of Email Address.
The type of email address, to distinguish between multiple instances of Email Address.

auc:TenantTelephoneNumberLabel.description: The type of telephone number, to distinguish between multiple instances of Telephone Number.
The type of telephone number, to distinguish between multiple instances of Telephone Number.

auc:ACAdjusted.description: Times when the HVAC equipment is setback. For example, when the heat is lowered during the heating season, or the cooling setpoint increased during the cooling season.

anyOf.description: ID number of HVAC delivery systems supporting the zone

items.description: ID number of HVAC delivery systems supporting the zone

anyOf.description: ID numbers of the heating, cooling, or other HVAC schedules associated with the zone.

items.description: ID numbers of the heating, cooling, or other HVAC schedules associated with the zone.

auc:HeatLowered.description: Times when the HVAC equipment is setback. For example, when the heat is lowered during the heating season, or the cooling setpoint increased during the cooling season.

auc:SetbackTemperatureHeating.description: Room temperature setting during reset periods. (F)

auc:SetpointTemperatureCooling.description: The lowest allowed range in setpoint. If there is no range, then the low and high setpoints are the same. (F)

auc:SetpointTemperatureHeating.description: The lowest allowed range in setpoint. If there is no range, then the low and high setpoints are the same. (F)

auc:SetupTemperatureCooling.description: Room temperature setting during reset periods. (F)

auc:Spaces.description: Areas of a building that share systems characteristics such as occupancy, plug loads, or lighting.

auc:CDDBaseTemperature.description: Reference temperature for calculating Cooling Degree Days (CDD). (F)

auc:CoolingDegreeDays.description: Cooling degree days are calculated as the sum of the differences between daily average temperatures and the base temperature, calculated at the ASHRAE base temperature of 65F, unless otherwise specified. Use the Interval Frequency term to characterize whether the HDD calculation is for annual or monthly intervals. (F-days)

auc:EndTimestamp.description: The timestamp that marks the end of the time series. (CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.zzz)

auc:EnergyFlowDirection.description: Direction associated with current related time series data.

auc:HDDBaseTemperature.description: Reference temperature for calculating Heating Degree Days (HDD). (F)

auc:HeatingDegreeDays.description: Heating degree days are calculated as the sum of the differences between daily average temperatures and the base temperature, calculated at the ASHRAE base temperature of 50F, unless otherwise specified. Use the Interval Frequency term to characterize whether the HDD calculation is for annual or monthly intervals. (F-days)

auc:IntervalFrequency.description: Indicates frequency of data that's available for a given variable. Data that's available can range from 10 minute interval to annual. This interval frequency can be applied to resource or other time series data like weather.

auc:IntervalReading.description: The numerical value of the reading. This has to be paired with Reading Type to specify whether this reading is mean, point, median, peak or minimum

auc:Phase.description: Phase information associated with electricity readings

auc:ReadingType.description: Type of data recorded by the meter or other source.

auc:ResourceUseID.description: ID number of resource use that this time series contributes to. This field is not used for non-energy data such as weather.

auc:StartTimestamp.description: The timestamp that marks the beginning of the time series. (CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.zzz)

auc:TimeSeriesReadingQuantity.description: Type of energy, water, power, weather metric included in the time series

auc:ElectricDistributionUtility.description: The company responsible for maintaining the utility lines and the electric distribution to the property. Note that the EDU is not the just "the utility company." In some states the energy markets are deregulated. This means that a property may contract with Company A to provide the power supply (energy from the power plant), while Company B will continue to provide the electric distribution (Company B is the EDU).

auc:FuelInterruptibility.description: This refers to the practice of supplementing fuel (electricity, natural gas, fuel oil.) by other means when there are interruptions in supply from the utility.

auc:MeteringConfiguration.description: The structure of how the various meters are arranged

auc:PowerPlant.description: Name of an individual power plant to which the property is directly connected

anyOf.description: Rate structure characteristics.

auc:AverageMarginalCostRate.description: The annual average cost of providing an additional unit of energy or water. Units should be consistent with Resource Units. ($/unit)

auc:FixedMonthlyCharge.description: The fixed charge or fee billed monthly regardless of consumption. ($/month)

auc:MinimumPowerFactorWithoutPenalty.description: Minimum power factor that needs to maintained without any penalties. (0-1) (%)

auc:NetMetering.description: Present if a billing mechanism is employed by utilities to credit onsite energy generation for this rate structure.

auc:AverageMarginalSellRate.description: Annual average rate to sell a unit of electricity back to the utility from customer site electricity generation through PV, wind etc. ($/kWh)

auc:RateStructureEffectiveDate.description: The first date the rate schedule becomes applicable. (CCYY-MM-DD)

auc:RateStructureEndDate.description: The date at which the rate schedule is no longer applicable. (CCYY-MM-DD)

auc:RateStructureName.description: The name or title of the rate structure.

auc:RateStructureSector.description: Sector to which the rate structure is applicable.

auc:ReactivePowerCharge.description: The additional charge for low power factor. ($/kVAR)

auc:ReferenceForRateStructure.description: Reference or hyper link for the rate schedule, tariff book

auc:TypeOfRateStructure.description: Basic type of rate structure used by the utility.

auc:CriticalPeakPricing.description: (CPP) - when utilities observe or anticipate high wholesale market prices or power system emergency conditions, they may call critical events during a specified time period (e.g., 3 p.m.6 p.m. on a hot summer weekday), the price for electricity during these time periods is substantially raised. Two variants of this type of rate design exist: one where the time and duration of the price increase are predetermined when events are called and another where the time and duration of the price increase may vary based on the electric grids need to have loads reduced

auc:CriticalPeakRebates.description: (CPR) - when utilities observe or anticipate high wholesale market prices or power system emergency conditions, they may call critical events during pre-specified time periods (e.g., 3 p.m.6 p.m. summer weekday afternoons), the price for electricity during these time periods remains the same but the customer is refunded at a single, predetermined value for any reduction in consumption relative to what the utility deemed the customer was expected to consume.

auc:FlatRate.description: A consumer will pay one flat rate no matter what the usage level is

auc:ApplicableEndDateForDemandRate.description: The date after which the rate is not applicable. (--MM-DD)

auc:ApplicableEndDateForEnergyRate.description: The date after which the rate is not applicable. (--MM-DD)

auc:ApplicableStartDateForDemandRate.description: The date from which the rate is applicable. (--MM-DD)

auc:ApplicableStartDateForEnergyRate.description: The date from which the rate is applicable. (--MM-DD)

auc:DemandRatchetPercentage.description: Certain rate schedules incorporate demand ratchet percentage to ensure minimum billing demands based on historical peak demands. Billing demand in these cases is based comparing the month's demand and maximum of previous 11 month's demand times the demand ratchet percentage. (0-1) (%)
