auc:VariablePeakPricing.description: (VPP) - a hybrid of time-of-use and real-time pricing where the different periods for pricing are defined in advance (e.g., on-peak=6 hours for summer weekday afternoon; off-peak = all other hours in the summer months), but the price established for the on-peak period varies by utility and market conditions.

auc:SourceSiteRatio.description: Ratio of energy consumed at a central power plant to that delivered to a customer.

auc:TypeOfResourceMeter.description: Meters can be divided into several categories based on their capabilities

auc:UtilityAccountNumber.description: Unique account number designated by the utility

auc:UtilityBillpayer.description: Organization that is responsible for paying the bills associated with this meter.

anyOf.description: Unique identification number for the meter

items.description: Unique identification number for the meter

auc:UtilityName.description: Name of utility company billing a Resource.

auc:CMUFill.description:
The fill condition of hollow unit masonry walls. The definitions correspond to the following conditions:

Solid: Where every cell is grouted

Empty: Where the cells are partially grouted and the remaining cells are left empty

Insulated: Where the cells are partially grouted and the remaining cells are filled with insulating material.

auc:ExteriorRoughness.description: A description of the roughness of the exposed surface of a material. This property is used to approximate the effect of the surface condition on the convection of air across the surface. In energy simulation models, it is used to help determine the convection coefficients for a surface.

auc:ExteriorWallColor.description: Color of a material or component. Can be applied to opaque surfaces, materials, and so forth.

auc:ExteriorWallConstruction.description: The general description of the main structural construction method used for an opaque surface.

auc:ExteriorWallFinish.description: The final material applied to a surface, either interior or exterior. Some structural components don't have an exterior finish, such as unfinished poured concrete.

auc:InteriorVisibleAbsorptance.description: The fraction of incident visible wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material or surface. (0-1) (%)

auc:WallExteriorSolarAbsorptance.description: The fraction of incident radiation in the solar spectrum that is absorbed by the material or surface. (0-1) (%)

auc:WallExteriorThermalAbsorptance.description: The fraction of incident long wavelength infrared radiation that is absorbed by the material or surface. (0-1) (%)

auc:WallFramingDepth.description: Dimension of the distance from the front to the back, such as the depth of structural framing in a wall or floor. It can also be the distance from the top to the bottom, such as the depth of a tank or pool of a component or material, such as the depth of the structural framing. (in.)

auc:WallFramingFactor.description: Fraction of the surface that is composed of structural framing material. (0-1) (%)

auc:WallFramingMaterial.description: The material used to create the structural integrity in an opaque surface. In many cases the framing material is not continuous across the construction.

auc:WallFramingSpacing.description: Dimension of the distance between two components. Framing spacing: the dimension from centerline to centerline of a surface framing material. (in.)

auc:WallInsulations.description: A description of the type of insulation and how it is applied.

auc:WallInsulationApplication.description: A description of the type of insulation and how it is applied.

auc:WallInsulationLocation.description: Whether wall insulation is on the inside or outside of the wall.

auc:WallInsulationMaterial.description: Material used for the structural component of the surface.

auc:WallInsulationRValue.description: Insulation R Value of the layer (hr-ft2-F/Btu)

auc:WallInsulationApplication.description: A description of the type of insulation and how it is applied.

auc:WallInsulationLocation.description: Whether wall insulation is on the inside or outside of the wall.

auc:WallInsulationMaterial.description: Material used for the structural component of the surface.

auc:WallInsulationRValue.description: Insulation R Value of the layer (hr-ft2-F/Btu)

auc:WallRValue.description: (Also known as thermal resistance), quantity determined by the temperature difference, at steady state, between two defined surfaces of a material or construction that induces a unit heat flow rate through unit area (R = T/q). R-value is the reciprocal of thermal conductance. A unit of thermal resistance used for comparing insulating values of different materials, for the specific thickness of the material. The higher the R-value number, a material, the greater its insulating properties and the slower the heat flow through it. This R-value does not include the interior and exterior air film coefficients. (hr-ft2-F/Btu)

auc:WallUFactor.description: The thermal transmission in unit time through a unit area of a particular body or assembly, including its boundary films, divided by the difference between the environmental temperatures on either side of the body or assembly. Note that the U-factor for a construction assembly, including fenestration, includes the interior and exterior film coefficients (the boundary films referenced above). (Btu/hrft2F)

auc:LowFlowFixtures.description: True if the fixtures used for this application include aerators, low flow toilets, or showerheads with flow restrictors

auc:WaterFixtureCyclesPerDay.description: Average number of draws per day for this fixture. (cycles/day)

auc:WaterFixtureFractionHotWater.description: Average fraction of water use for this application that is drawn from the hot water system. (0-1) (%)

auc:WaterFixtureRatedFlowRate.description: Rated volumetric flow rate of the water fixture. (gpm)

auc:WaterFixtureVolumePerCycle.description: Average amount of water used per cycle of the fixture. (gal/cycle)

auc:WaterUseType.description: Short description of the water fixture or application.
